channel.title: All The Smoke
channel.description: ALL THE SMOKE pairs two of the most outspoken and controversial players of their time. Known as fiery, intense competitors during their on-court careers, Matt Barnes and Stephen Jackson are now two of the most widely respected voices by today’s crop of NBA stars. Serving as mentors to numerous players throughout the league and with their hands firmly on the pulse of the game, they have first-hand insight into the minds, lives and pressing issues facing today’s players. Barnes and Jackson, who have played alongside two generations of All-Stars, will dish on the latest news and drama from on and off the court without boundaries.

item.title: Bubba Wallace | Ep 158 | ALL THE SMOKE Full Episode | SHOWTIME Basketball x MoneyLion
item.itunes:title: Bubba Wallace | Ep 158 | ALL THE SMOKE Full Episode | SHOWTIME Basketball x MoneyLion
item.description:
All The Smoke rolls on with another must-see, exclusive interview. On episode 158, Matt and Stak sit down with Nascar star Bubba Wallace to chop it up. Wallace discusses driving for Michael Jordan's racing team and shares some epic MJ stories. Plus, he opens about being the only black NASCAR driver and gives his perspective on the 'noose' incident.

item.title: Steve Nash FIRED, Cavs & Bucks Hot Start, Week 2 NBA Reactions | WHAT’S BURNIN | Showtime Basketball
item.itunes:title: Steve Nash FIRED, Cavs & Bucks Hot Start, Week 2 NBA Reactions | WHAT’S BURNIN | Showtime Basketball
item.description:
Just another NORMAL week in the NBA and the guys have you covered. On the latest episode, Matt & Stak react in real-time to the firing of Nets head coach Steve Nash and discuss what's next for the controversial but talent squad in Brooklyn. Plus, breakdown the hot starts of both the Cavs & the Bucks and talk Giannis' incredible talent. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:

item.description:
Season 4 of ATS continues to bring you unmatched interviews. This week, the guys are joined by 'Superman' himself, Dwight Howard, for a must-see interview where he opens up about his 19-year NBA Journey.

He reflects on his time in Orlando, his relationship with Kobe, his injury struggles, his feud with Shaq and shares many other never-before-told stories. Plus, he gives an update on joining a team for this upcoming NBA season.

The hall of fame point guard discusses what it's like coaching Luka Doncic, Jalen Brunson leaving for the Knicks, and how he learned from his previous coaching failures. Plus, he opens up about his legendary career, including his time with the Nets and playing in 2 NBA finals.

item.title: The Black Effect Presents: Naked with Cari Champion
item.itunes:title: The Black Effect Presents: Naked with Cari Champion
item.description:
The Black Effect BONUS Episode: Check out this brand-new episode of Naked with Cari Champion, our sister show on the Black Effect Podcast Network. 

“The Rich Paul Rule with Rich Paul”

Growing up in Cleveland, Ohio, Rich Paul used every example around him to shape the power player he is today. From founder/owner of Klutch Sports to being the only Black board member at one of the biggest entertainment agencies in the world, Rich Paul is unstoppable.

This week, Rich Paul gets naked with Cari Champion about the lessons he’s learned along the way.

You can follow Cari Champion on IG and Twitter. For more Naked with Cari Champion, visit the iHeartradio app, Apple Podcasts or wherever you listen to your favorite shows.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

On a special #GRAMMYs episode of ALL THE SMOKE, rap artists E-40 & Too $hort join the boys to talk about their careers and share some stories from the music world. Plus, they dive into the 'We Believe' Warriors and the impact Dr. Dre has had on the rap game.


The 63rd #GRAMMYs will air on Sunday, March 14, 2021 on CBS.

item.description:
ALL THE SMOKE is back with another special Christmas week episode as 2020 NBA champ Rajon Rondo joins the boys to talk about his crazy NBA career. Rondo opens up about what it's like playing with Lebron and talks winning the championship with the Lakers in the bubble. Plus, the former Celtic talks about his time in Boston with KG, Paul Pierce and Ray Allen, winning the title in 2008, and shares other great stories from his time in bean town. Also, the new Hawk talks about his 2020 free agency and why he choose to continue his career in Atlanta with Trae Young and the young Hawks.

item.itunes:title: Chris Bosh | Ep 57 | ALL THE SMOKE Full Episode | SHOWTIME Basketball
item.description:
2x-NBA Champion and one of the best power forwards to play the game, Chris Bosh joins Matt and Stak on the newest episode of ALL THE SMOKE to dive into his roller coaster NBA career. Bosh discusses leaving Toronto to join the Heat and form the first big 3 en route to winning 2 titles in Miami. He also opens up about Lebron's greatness and talks leaving the game early due to medical reasons. Plus, Bosh shares stories about the legendary 2003 draft class, playing with Vinsinity as a rookie, the infamous Ray Allen shot in Game 6 of the 2013 NBA Finals and his battles with new Hall Of Famer Kevin Garnett.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: KOBE BRYANT
item.description:
All The Smoke welcomes The Black Mamba to the show! Kobe and Stack reminisce about the 1996 McDonald's All-American Boys Game. Stack says he should have won the MVP, does Kobe agree? Kobe talks about the team that stopped the Lakers from winning even more championships, Matt getting feisty with Kobe, lack of playing time in his first three years and his break during the NBA lockout that lead to the beginning of one of the greatest careers in American sports.

item.title: MATT AND STACK ON TALKIN' SMACK AND THEIR NBA EXPERIENCE
item.itunes:title: MATT AND STACK ON TALKIN' SMACK AND THEIR NBA EXPERIENCE
item.description:
Matt and Stack talk about dealing with Kobe Bryant and his trash talk and the mental part of his game. Stack reflects on the 2003 Spurs team that knocked off the Lakers and ended their attempt at a 4th consecutive title. Matt talks about the high expectation of The Clippers Lob City team and how they fell short against The Rockets which led to the beginning of the Warriors run. Segue into the current Clippers and the job Doc Rivers is doing and the opportunity they have. Stack talks about returning to The Spurs and the tough loss to OKC.
